meanings.definition: A person who wills or desires something.
meanings.sent1: The young girl was a strong willers when it came to getting what she wanted.
meanings.sent2: Many willers gathered outside the store hoping to buy the limited edition item.
meanings.sent3: The willers in the group all wanted to go to the beach, but they ended up at the park instead.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like that of a willers chasing a dream that seemed impossible.
meanings.sent5: The willers in the story never gave up on their quest to find the hidden treasure.

meanings.definition: The act of willing or desiring something.
meanings.sent1: His willers to succeed in his career drove him to work hard every day.
meanings.sent2: The willers for change among the people led to a revolution.
meanings.sent3: The willers for ice cream after dinner was strong among the kids.
meanings.sent4: The willers for knowledge burned brightly in her heart.
meanings.sent5: Their willers for justice could not be ignored by the authorities.

meanings.definition: The ability to make decisions and choices.
meanings.sent1: Having strong willers allowed him to overcome any obstacle in his path.
meanings.sent2: The willers to choose the right path in life is a valuable skill.
meanings.sent3: The willers to pick the winning lottery numbers was tempting but risky.
meanings.sent4: Her willers to lead the team to victory inspired everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The willers to explore new horizons led them on an exciting adventure.
